issue.title: <frame/>: Support multiple frames in a single parent? Intended scope of frames? Use link names as frames?

content.raw:
1) Yes, the intent is to support multiple frames per parent. I'll work on updating the  unittest.

2) Yes, a frame in model should be able to reference a frame in a child link. I'll tackle the unittest while work in part 1.

2.a) I agree that it's ambiguous. Historically, SDF has assumed that a `<pose>` is relative to it's parent SDF element. In your example, the  link's pose would be in the parent model frame. I'll update the documentation to say that a `<pose>` element with an unnamed `frame` attribute will use the parent element's frame.

4) Automatic frames are a good idea. Are you interested in taking a look at this, or should I?

2) Yes, a frame in model should be able to reference a frame in a child link. I'll tackle the unittest while work in part 1.

2.a) I agree that it's ambiguous. Historically, SDF has assumed that a <pose> is relative to it's parent SDF element. In your example, the link's pose would be in the parent model frame. I'll update the documentation to say that a <pose> element with an unnamed frame attribute will use the parent element's frame.

4) Automatic frames are a good idea. Are you interested in taking a look at this, or should I?
